snippet: The tiny Persian Gulf emirate of Qatar is a state that boxes well above its weight. Hence Syria's paranoia about its alleged support for forces accused of seeking to overthrow the regime in Damascus - including the Qatari broadcaster Al Jazeera.
abstract: The tiny Persian Gulf emirate of Qatar is a state that boxes well above its weight. Hence Syria's paranoia about its alleged support for forces accused of seeking to overthrow the regime in Damascus - including the Qatari broadcaster Al Jazeera.
lead_paragraph: LONDON - The Syrian regime is in no doubt about who sits at the center of a web of international conspiracy seeking to undermine it: the rulers of the tiny Persian Gulf state of Qatar.

headline.main: Who's Pulling the Strings in the Middle East? Little Qatar, Says Syria.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
